title: Skin Abscess
diagnosis_topic: Localized soft tissue infection with purulent collection
setup_script: A 35-year-old woman presents with a painful, red lump on her right thigh that has enlarged over the past week. She has a low-grade fever and no significant medical history.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 118/72 mmHg, HR 88 bpm, RR 16/min, Temp 37.8 C.
4 cm erythematous, fluctuant mass with central punctum; surrounding cellulitis present.
Not routinely necessary but CBC shows WBC 12 K/uL.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident incises and drains the abscess under local anesthesia
dynamic_flow.reply: Thick purulent material evacuated; wound irrigated.
Culture obtained to guide antibiotic therapy if risk factors present.
Not needed for small abscesses in healthy individuals; consider trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole for MRSA coverage if systemic symptoms or surrounding cellulitis.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident neglects to perform I&D
dynamic_flow.reply: Abscess may rupture spontaneously and spread infection.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident asks about risk factors for MRSA
dynamic_flow.reply: Recent hospitalization, IV drug use, close contact outbreaks.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident advises warm compresses and wound care
If resident discusses packing versus loose closure
dynamic_flow.reply: Small cavity may be left open without packing; larger cavities may be loosely packed to prevent premature closure.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident assesses for underlying diabetes or immunosuppression

dynamic_flow.reply: Reevaluate in 2-3 days for persistent infection or need for further debridement.
